summary: Evaluate and potentially implement Ractor-based sandboxing for Ruby SDK workflows. The main blocker is Google::Protobuf incompatibility with Ractors, which would require implementing a custom Protobuf solution.
userImpact: Users could benefit from better workflow state isolation through Ractor-based sandboxing, but the feature is blocked by ecosystem limitations.
rootCause: Google::Protobuf library does not support Ractors, and ecosystem support is still experimental
proposedFix: Implement a custom Protobuf solution using method_missing approach (similar to Ruby extension implementation)
resolutionDetails: Decision made to defer Ractor-based workflows due to Google::Protobuf incompatibility and experimental status. Will revisit when ecosystem support improves.
keyQuote: It has been decided that while there are a lot of state-isolation benefits to Ractor-based workflows, since `Google::Protobuf` doesn't support them and since they are experimental, it is not worth the effort to require them today.
